00001 /*
00002 ###############################################################################
00003 #
00004 #  EGSnrc egs++ smart envelope geometry
00005 #  Copyright (C) 2015 National Research Council Canada
00006 #
00007 #  This file is part of EGSnrc.
00008 #
00009 #  EGSnrc is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
00010 #  the terms of the GNU Affero General Public License as published by the
00011 #  Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your
00012 #  option) any later version.
00013 #
00014 #  EGSnrc is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY
00015 #  WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS
00016 #  FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU Affero General Public License for
00017 #  more details.
00018 #
00019 #  You should have received a copy of the GNU Affero General Public License
00020 #  along with EGSnrc. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
00021 #
00022 ###############################################################################
00023 #
00024 #  Author:          Iwan Kawrakow, 2008
00025 #
00026 #  Contributors:    Frederic Tessier
00027 #
00028 ###############################################################################
00029 #
00030 #  A "smart" envelope geometry. The smartness is due to the fact that there
00031 #  can be only zero or one inscribed geometry per base geometry region, which
00032 #  makes many of the checks faster.
00033 #
00034 #  In addition, unlike the regular envelope geometry where all inscribed
00035 #  geometries always must completely fit inside the base geometry, here
00036 #  geometries can be inscribed using logic 0 or 1.
00037 #
00038 #  Logic 0 is as before, i.e., geometry must completely fit into the region
00039 #  where it is being inscribed.
00040 #
00041 #  Logic 1 means that the inscribed geometry extends beyond the region and
00042 #  therefore the smart envelope also checks the base geometry in this case.
00043 #  This is very similar to a CD geometry except that now the space outside
00044 #  the inscribed geometry is still part of the geometry.
00045 #
00046 #  Warning: not completely tested, so don't use for production runs yet.
00047 #
00048 ###############################################################################
00049 */
00050 
00051

00082 struct EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL SmartEnvelopeAux {
00083     EGS_BaseGeometry *g;
00084     int              ireg;
00085     int              type;
00086     int              nreg;
00087     int              *regs;
00088     SmartEnvelopeAux() : g(0), ireg(-1), type(0), nreg(0) {};
00089     ~SmartEnvelopeAux() { if(nreg>0) delete [] regs; };
00090 };
00091 
00092 EGS_SmartEnvelope::EGS_SmartEnvelope(EGS_BaseGeometry *G,
00093          const vector<SmartEnvelopeAux *> &fgeoms, const string &Name) :
00094          EGS_BaseGeometry(Name), geometries(0), gindex(0),
00095          reg_to_inscr(0), reg_to_base(0), local_start(0), itype(0) {
00096     if( !G ) egsFatal("EGS_SmartEnvelope: base geometry must not be null\n");
00097     g = G; g->ref();
00098     n_in = fgeoms.size();
00099     if( !n_in ) egsFatal("EGS_SmartEnvelope: no inscribed geometries!\n");
00100     geometries = new EGS_BaseGeometry * [n_in];
00101     nbase = g->regions();
00102     gindex = new int [nbase]; itype = new char [fgeoms.size()]; int j;
00103     for(j=0; j<nbase; j++) gindex[j] = -1;
00104     for(j=0; j<fgeoms.size(); j++) itype[j] = 0;
00105     int nlist = 0;
00106     int nreg_inscribed = 0; bool ok = true;
00107     for(j=0; j<fgeoms.size(); j++) {
00108         geometries[j] = fgeoms[j]->g; geometries[j]->ref();
00109         int i = fgeoms[j]->ireg;
00110         if( gindex[i] >= 0 ) {
00111             egsWarning("EGS_SmartEnvelope:"
00112             " There can only be a single geometry inscribed in a region\n");
00113             egsWarning(" You are trying to inscribe %s into region %d but\n",
00114                  geometries[j]->getName().c_str(),i);
00115             egsWarning(" geometry %s is already inscribed in this region\n",
00116                  geometries[gindex[i]]->getName().c_str());
00117             ok = false;
00118         }
00119         else {
00120             gindex[i] = j; itype[j] = fgeoms[j]->type;
00121             //egsInformation("inscribing %d into %d with type %d\n",j,i,itype[j]);
00122             nreg_inscribed += geometries[j]->regions();
00123         }
00124     }
00125     if( !ok ) egsFatal("EGS_SmartEnvelope: errors during definition\n");
00126     nreg = nbase + nreg_inscribed;
00127     local_start = new int [fgeoms.size()];
00128     reg_to_inscr = new int [nreg_inscribed];
00129     reg_to_base = new int [nreg_inscribed];
00130     int nr = 0;
00131     for(j=0; j<fgeoms.size(); j++) {
00132         local_start[j] = nbase + nr; int nj = geometries[j]->regions();
00133         for(int i=nr; i<nr+nj; ++i) {
00134             reg_to_inscr[i] = j;
00135             reg_to_base[i] = fgeoms[j]->ireg;
00136         }
00137         nr += nj;
00138     }
00139     is_convex = g->isConvex();
00140     has_rho_scaling = g->hasRhoScaling();
00141     if( !has_rho_scaling ) {
00142         for(int j=0; j<n_in; j++) {
00143             if( geometries[j]->hasRhoScaling() ) {
00144                 has_rho_scaling = true; break;
00145             }
00146         }
00147     }
00148 }
00149 
00150 EGS_SmartEnvelope::~EGS_SmartEnvelope() {
00151     if( !g->deref() ) delete g;
00152     for(int j=0; j<n_in; j++) {
00153         if( !geometries[j]->deref() ) delete geometries[j];
00154     }
00155     if( geometries) delete [] geometries;
00156     if( gindex ) delete [] gindex;
00157     if( reg_to_inscr ) delete [] reg_to_inscr;
00158     if( reg_to_base  ) delete [] reg_to_base ;
00159     if( local_start ) delete [] local_start;
00160     if( itype ) delete itype;
00161 }

00163 void EGS_SmartEnvelope::printInfo() const {
00164     EGS_BaseGeometry::printInfo();
00165     egsInformation(" base geometry = %s (type %s)\n",g->getName().c_str(),
00166             g->getType().c_str());
00167     egsInformation(" inscribed geometries:\n");
00168     for(int j=0; j<n_in; j++) egsInformation("   %s (type %s) in region=%d, "
00169         " itype=%d\n",
00170         geometries[j]->getName().c_str(),geometries[j]->getType().c_str(),
00171         reg_to_base[j],(int)itype[j]);
00172     egsInformation(
00173             "=======================================================\n");
00174 }

00177 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message1[] =
00178     "createGeometry(smart envelope): %s\n";
00179 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message2[] =
00180     "null input?";
00181 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message3[] =
00182     "no 'base geometry' input?";
00183 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message4[] =
00184     "incorrect base geometry definition";
00185 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message5[] =
00186     "missing/incorrect 'base geometry' input";
00187 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message6[] =
00188     "createGeometry(smart envelope): no geometry with name %s defined\n";
00189 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message7[] =
00190     "no inscirebed geometries defined?. I hope you know what you are doing";
00191 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_message8[] =
00192     "an error occured while constructing inscibed geometries";
00193 
00194 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_keyword1[] = "base geometry";
00195 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_keyword2[] = "geometry";
00196 static char EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_LOCAL eeg_keyword3[] = "inscribed geometries";
00197 
00198 extern "C" {
00199 
00200 EGS_SMART_ENVELOPE_EXPORT EGS_BaseGeometry* createGeometry(EGS_Input *input) {
00201     if( !input ) {
00202         egsWarning(eeg_message1,eeg_message2);
00203         return 0;
00204     }
00205     //
00206     // *** Base geometry
00207     //
00208     EGS_Input *i = input->takeInputItem(eeg_keyword1);
00209     if( !i ) {
00210         egsWarning(eeg_message1,eeg_message3); return 0;
00211     }
00212     EGS_Input *ig = i->takeInputItem(eeg_keyword2);
00213     EGS_BaseGeometry *g;
00214     if( ig ) { // defined inline
00215         g = EGS_BaseGeometry::createSingleGeometry(ig);
00216         delete ig;
00217         if( !g ) {
00218             egsWarning(eeg_message1,eeg_message4);
00219             delete i; return 0;
00220         }
00221     }
00222     else {  // defined via a name of a previously defined geometry
00223         string bgname;
00224         int err = i->getInput(eeg_keyword1,bgname);
00225         delete i;
00226         if( err ) {
00227             egsWarning(eeg_message1,eeg_message5); return 0;
00228         }
00229         g = EGS_BaseGeometry::getGeometry(bgname);
00230         if( !g ) {
00231             egsWarning(eeg_message6,bgname.c_str()); return 0;
00232         }
00233     }
00234     vector<SmartEnvelopeAux *> fgeoms;
00235     int nbase = g->regions();
00236     EGS_Input *ix;
00237     while( (ix = input->takeInputItem("inscribe geometry")) != 0 ) {
00238         vector<string> values;
00239         ix->getInput("inscribe geometry",values);
00240         if( values.size() < 2 ) egsWarning("createGeometry(smart envelope):"
00241               " %d inputs for 'inscribe geometry'? 2 or more are needed\n",values.size());
00242         else {
00243             EGS_BaseGeometry *gj = EGS_BaseGeometry::getGeometry(values[0]);
00244             if( !gj ) egsWarning(eeg_message6,values[0].c_str());
00245             else {
00246                 SmartEnvelopeAux *aux = new SmartEnvelopeAux;
00247                 aux->g = gj;
00248                 aux->ireg = atoi(values[1].c_str());
00249                 aux->type = values.size() == 3 ? atoi(values[2].c_str()) : 0;
00250                 //egsInformation("set geometr: %s %d %d\n",values[0].c_str(),aux->ireg,aux->type);
00251                 if( aux->ireg < 0 || aux->ireg >= nbase ) {
00252                     egsWarning("createGeometry(smart envelope): wrong "
00253                          "region index %d for inscribed geometry %s\n",
00254                          aux->ireg,gj->getName().c_str());
00255                     delete aux;
00256                 }
00257                 else fgeoms.push_back(aux);
00258             }
00259         }
00260         delete ix;
00261     }
00262     EGS_BaseGeometry *result = new EGS_SmartEnvelope(g,fgeoms,"");
00263     result->setName(input);
00264     result->setLabels(input);
00265     for(int j=0; j<fgeoms.size(); j++) delete fgeoms[j];
00266     return result;
00267 
00268 }
00269 
00270 void EGS_SmartEnvelope::getLabelRegions (const string &str, vector<int> &regs) {
00271 
00272     // label defined in the envelope geometry
00273     g->getLabelRegions(str, regs);
00274 
00275     // label defined in the inscribed geometries
00276     vector<int> gregs;
00277     int shift=0;
00278     for (int i=0; i<n_in; i++) {
00279 
00280         // add regions from set geometries
00281         gregs.clear();
00282         if (geometries[i]) geometries[i]->getLabelRegions(str, gregs);
00283 
00284         // shift region numbers according to indexing style
00285         for (int j=0; j<gregs.size(); j++) {
00286             gregs[j] += local_start[i];
00287         }
00288 
00289         // add regions to the list
00290         regs.insert(regs.end(), gregs.begin(), gregs.end());
00291 
00292     }
00293 
00294     // label defined in self (envelope geometry input block)
00295     EGS_BaseGeometry::getLabelRegions(str, regs);
00296 
00297 }
